title: Ashford Hill Walk Route

images.title: Andrew Smith / Ashford Hill Meadows, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ashford Hill Meadows. The main stream providing the floodwaters is in the trees to the right, though water was also spilling from a ditch to the left.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Ashford Hill Meadows, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ashford Hill Meadows with village pub in the background

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pasture, Ashford Hill, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pasture, Ashford Hill Fields south of Tucker's Hill Farm. This was taken at the corner on the public footpath.

images.title: Pam Brophy / Ashford Hill Village, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ashford Hill Village. The Ship Inn is situated on the outskirts of the village, in the south eastern quadrant of the grid square. The picture was taken from the south western side of the building. Now an arts centre.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Meadow, Ashford Hill
images.caption: Meadow. A flowery meadow in the valley of a brook that makes its way towards the River Enborne.

images.title: Pam Brophy / The stream under the Axmansford Bridge
images.caption: The stream under the Axmansford Bridge. This view of the stream is of the south side of the bridge and the picture was taken from the west side of the bridge. It is situated in the extreme south eastern section of the grid square.

images.title: Graham Horn / Footbridge within Ashford Hill Meadows Nature Reserve
images.caption: This footbridge, with its distinctive concrete bicycle traps, crosses the embryo River Enbourne within the nature reserve.

images.title: don cload / Stream at Haughurst Hill
images.caption: Stream at Haughurst Hill

description: Explore the old water meadows and woodland in this pretty nature reserve near Newbury. You can start the circular walk from the car park at the Ship Inn in the village of Ashford Hill. From here you pick up footpaths through the nature reserve towards Haughurst Hill and Sleepers Copse. The reserve is great for wildlife spotting with several species of butterfly to look out for amongst the wildflowers. Back in the little village you can enjoy refreshments at the Ship Inn. The Brenda Parker Way long distance footpath runs through the reserve so there is scope for extending your walk. Also nearby is Wasing Wood, riverside paths along the River Enborne and Greenham Common. The expansive area of heathland is covered in heather and gorse and has nice wide footpaths, wetland areas and wildflower filled grasslands with horses and ponies to look out for. To the east you'll find Pamber Forest with more peaceful woodland trails to try. There's also the worthy town of Tadley and the fascinating ancient Roman Fort at Silchester to explore here.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Just to the east there's the Badger's Wood pub in Baughurst. You can find them at postcode RG26 5JH for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails are ideal for dog walking so you will probably meet other owners on your visit. The Badger's Wood mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just north of Newbury you can visit the historic Donnington Castle and enjoy a walk around the attractive heathland of Snelsmore Common Country Park.

display_address: Pam's Bridge, Ashford Hill, Ashford Hill with Headley, Axmansford, Basingstoke and Deane, Hampshire, England, RG19 8BD, United Kingdom
